a.title: Go to comments for Temporary Guidelines for Food Assistance

span.h2: Custer School District will remain closed for the remainder of the year through May 21, per Governor Noem's announcement that all schools in South Dakota should remain closed for the rest of the school year. All activities will be canceled as well. We will continue to post announcements via SchoolMessenger, here and on our Facebook pages.

h2.span: Please take time to find out how your school is responding to the integrity of continuing your student's education while we are out of school for this extended period of time.

span.h2: Custer SR/JR High has responded with teachers creating an extended series of lessons for students that include online and paper copies. Please communicate with your instructors via email for any further information or questions.

p.span:
IMPORTANT SCHOOL WORK INFORMATION
FOR ALL STUDENTS JK-12
IN HERMOSA & CUSTER
To all our Custer Elementary & Jr/Sr High Students & Families ~ Next Homework Pick-up / Drop-off ~

span.p: Kids/parents check in with the attendants
Attendants will bring work AND Locker materials to the curb

p.span: Message from the JR/SR High Office ~
We cleaned out lockers and collected items in bags with the student's names and will also give those out next Thursday.Seniors will also be given their CUM files then.

Thank you for all you are doing to help us educate our students! If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Principal Orion Thompson orion.thompson@k12.sd.us or Admin. Assistant Jan Wilson jan.wilson@k12.sd.us or call and leave a message at 673-4473
CHS Yearbooks will be purchased online and then delivered to your home. Click on the following link to order your student's

CES is having the next homework pick-up and drop-off at the CES main entrance on Thursday, April 23rd from 6:30am-2pm. All student belongings will be returned to families along with new work. We are asking you to drop off the completed work at the time you stop to get the new work. This process will be a drive-up style, like we are doing with the meal deliveries at CES. We will bring you the new work and collect the completed work and you can be on your way. We appreciate your patience as we are delivering work for 300 students. From Principal Paulson
We still plan to have a yearbook this year, but with the current situation, the printing will be delayed. Email joey.kortemeyer@k12.sd.us if you want to order a yearbook.

Hello Hermosa Families ~ April 30, pick-up and drop-off homework from 6:30am to 2pm. If you haven't received your student's belongings already, please come on the 30th and you will be given those - this applies to all K-8 students. If you know of someone in need of assistance, please let me know and we can reach out to them. Thank you for all you are doing to help us educate our students! Lori.enright@k12.sd.us

span.h2: Free grab and go breakfast and lunch available to CSD K-12 students.

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: Grab and Go

strong.u: LSI & CSD Hermosa School GRAB & GO MEALS PLAN

span.h2: Revised Lunch Schedule - Lunchtime Solutions Inc. and Hermosa School will be distributing free grab & go breakfasts and lunches to any of our students (JK-12th grade) who would like meals this week. Drop off points at Hermosa School at the walking door at 11:30am, Fairburn at the old school at 11:30am, Prairie Winds at 11:00am, R U Mobil at 11:15am, Walnut Grove at 11:30am, Ferguson Development at 11:45am. We will wait 10-15 minutes at each pick up point to distribute meals. Students will get a breakfast and lunch each day. Please understand that adjustments may need to be made as we find the best way to do this for our students. Thanks.
span.p: The banner goes above the larger ad, and the banner will include this hyperlink: https://www.treering.com/validate?PassCode=1015233808932220 to look something like this:
I have already put the link inside the banner that is formatted on top of the larger ad, so perhaps it will copy and paste easily otherwise the files are also attached to this email.

br.br: To Educate Every Student toHis or Her Potential

br.span: To provide the highest educational program possible through positive leadership, quality academics, and an array of opportunities for social, emotional, physical, and character development so graduates:
a) Go on to compete in the marketplace
b) Understand the importance of community involvement; and
To provide the highest educational program possible so the district can compete successfully in the educational marketplace

button.aria-label: Scroll To The Top Of The Page

div.span: CSD Non-Discrimination Statement The Custer School District 16-1 does not discriminate on the basis of race or color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy),disability, sexual orientation, age, religion and creed, military/veteran status, or marital status, in admission or access to or treatment or employment in its programs and activities: and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. For inquiries concerning the Districts compliance with Title VI or the Age Discrimination Act please contact the Superintendent of Schools, 527 Montgomery St., Custer, SD, 57730, (605) 673-3154; for Title IX please contact the Activities Director, 1645 Wildcat Lane, Custer, SD, 57730, (605)673-4473; or for Section 504 of the Americans with Disabilities (ADA) act please contact the Special Education Director, 527 Montgomery St., Custer, SD, 57730, (605)673-3154. For further inquiries contact the South Dakota Regional Office for Civil Rights, Kansas City Office, U.S.Dept. of Education, One Petticoat Lane, 1010 Walnut Street, Suite 320, Kansas City, MO, 64106, phone (816) 268-0550, TDD (800) 877-0599, Fax (816) 268-0559, e-mail: OCR.KansasCity@ed.gov.
